text: Eric Norman 'Mick' Craigie (1917-2004) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s. Craigie joined the saints after his discharge from the Australian Army in 1942WW2 Nominal Roll E.N.Craigie http://www.ww2roll.gov.au/Veteran.aspx?ServiceId=A&VeteranId;=314102 After moving into the St. George Area in 1943 at Ramsgate, New South Wales, he joined St. George. Craigie was promoted from Reserve Grade at St. George in 1943 and was the reserve lock for first grade, between 1943-1945. He went on to captain the first grade team on a few occasions in 1943.St.George Call (Kogarah) 1/6/1945 Mick Craigie reference (Article) https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/233603442?searchTerm=%22craigie%22%20%22st.george%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=194|||l-year=1945 Craigie retired at the end of the 1945 season. Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. Eric Norman (Mick) Craigie died on 4 September 2004 at Brighton-Le-Sands, New South Wales aged 87.Sydney Morning Herald - Death Notice 9/9/2004 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Australian military personnel of World War II Category:1917 births Category:2004 deaths
title: Mick Craigie
